void Calculation_of_the_LTP_parameters P4 (  (d, dp, bc_out, Nc_out)  ,
register word *  d,
register word *  dp,
word *  bc_out,
word *  Nc_out
)  [static]
  

00079 {
00080     register ulongword utmp;    /* for L_ADD */
00081 
00082     register int    k, lambda;
00083     word        Nc, bc;
00084     word        wt[40];
00085 
00086     longword    L_max, L_power;
00087     word        R, S, dmax, scal;
00088     register word   temp;
00089 
00090     /*  Search of the optimum scaling of d[0..39].
00091      */
00092     dmax = 0;
00093 
00094     for (k = 0; k <= 39; k++) {
00095         temp = d[k];
00096         temp = GSM_ABS( temp );
00097         if (temp > dmax) dmax = temp;
00098     }
00099 
00100     temp = 0;
00101     if (dmax == 0) scal = 0;
00102     else {
00103         assert(dmax > 0);
00104         temp = gsm_norm( dmax << 16 );
00105     }
00106 
00107     if (temp > 6) scal = 0;
00108     else scal = 6 - temp;
00109 
00110     assert(scal >= 0);
00111 
00112     /*  Initialization of a working array wt
00113      */
00114 
00115     for (k = 0; k <= 39; k++) wt[k] = SASR( d[k], scal );
00116 
00117     /* Search for the maximum cross-correlation and coding of the LTP lag
00118      */
00119     L_max = 0;
00120     Nc    = 40; /* index for the maximum cross-correlation */
00121 
00122     for (lambda = 40; lambda <= 120; lambda++) {
00123 
00124 # undef STEP
00125 # ifdef USE_TABLE_MUL
00126 #       define STEP(k) (table_mul(wt[k], dp[k - lambda]))
00127 # else
00128 #       define STEP(k) (wt[k] * dp[k - lambda])
00129 # endif
00130 
00131         register longword L_result;
00132 
00133         L_result  = STEP(0)  ; L_result += STEP(1) ;
00134         L_result += STEP(2)  ; L_result += STEP(3) ;
00135         L_result += STEP(4)  ; L_result += STEP(5)  ;
00136         L_result += STEP(6)  ; L_result += STEP(7)  ;
00137         L_result += STEP(8)  ; L_result += STEP(9)  ;
00138         L_result += STEP(10) ; L_result += STEP(11) ;
00139         L_result += STEP(12) ; L_result += STEP(13) ;
00140         L_result += STEP(14) ; L_result += STEP(15) ;
00141         L_result += STEP(16) ; L_result += STEP(17) ;
00142         L_result += STEP(18) ; L_result += STEP(19) ;
00143         L_result += STEP(20) ; L_result += STEP(21) ;
00144         L_result += STEP(22) ; L_result += STEP(23) ;
00145         L_result += STEP(24) ; L_result += STEP(25) ;
00146         L_result += STEP(26) ; L_result += STEP(27) ;
00147         L_result += STEP(28) ; L_result += STEP(29) ;
00148         L_result += STEP(30) ; L_result += STEP(31) ;
00149         L_result += STEP(32) ; L_result += STEP(33) ;
00150         L_result += STEP(34) ; L_result += STEP(35) ;
00151         L_result += STEP(36) ; L_result += STEP(37) ;
00152         L_result += STEP(38) ; L_result += STEP(39) ;
00153 
00154         if (L_result > L_max) {
00155 
00156             Nc    = lambda;
00157             L_max = L_result;
00158         }
00159     }
00160 
00161     *Nc_out = Nc;
00162 
00163     L_max <<= 1;
00164 
00165     /*  Rescaling of L_max
00166      */
00167     assert(scal <= 100 && scal >=  -100);
00168     L_max = L_max >> (6 - scal);    /* sub(6, scal) */
00169 
00170     assert( Nc <= 120 && Nc >= 40);
00171 
00172     /*   Compute the power of the reconstructed short term residual
00173      *   signal dp[..]
00174      */
00175     L_power = 0;
00176     for (k = 0; k <= 39; k++) {
00177 
00178         register longword L_temp;
00179 
00180         L_temp   = SASR( dp[k - Nc], 3 );
00181         L_power += L_temp * L_temp;
00182     }
00183     L_power <<= 1;  /* from L_MULT */
00184 
00185     /*  Normalization of L_max and L_power
00186      */
00187 
00188     if (L_max <= 0)  {
00189         *bc_out = 0;
00190         return;
00191     }
00192     if (L_max >= L_power) {
00193         *bc_out = 3;
00194         return;
00195     }
00196 
00197     temp = gsm_norm( L_power );
00198 
00199     R = SASR( L_max   << temp, 16 );
00200     S = SASR( L_power << temp, 16 );
00201 
00202     /*  Coding of the LTP gain
00203      */
00204 
00205     /*  Table 4.3a must be used to obtain the level DLB[i] for the
00206      *  quantization of the LTP gain b to get the coded version bc.
00207      */
00208     for (bc = 0; bc <= 2; bc++) if (R <= gsm_mult(S, gsm_DLB[bc])) break;
00209     *bc_out = bc;
00210 }

void Gsm_Long_Term_Synthesis_Filtering P5 (  (S, Ncr, bcr, erp, drp)  ,
struct gsm_state *  S,
word  Ncr,
word  bcr,
register word *  erp,
register word *  drp
) 
  

00579 {
00580     register longword   ltmp;   /* for ADD */
00581     register int        k;
00582     word            brp, drpp, Nr;
00583 
00584     /*  Check the limits of Nr.
00585      */
00586     Nr = Ncr < 40 || Ncr > 120 ? S->nrp : Ncr;
00587     S->nrp = Nr;
00588     assert(Nr >= 40 && Nr <= 120);
00589 
00590     /*  Decoding of the LTP gain bcr
00591      */
00592     brp = gsm_QLB[ bcr ];
00593 
00594     /*  Computation of the reconstructed short term residual 
00595      *  signal drp[0..39]
00596      */
00597     assert(brp != MIN_WORD);
00598 
00599     for (k = 0; k <= 39; k++) {
00600         drpp   = GSM_MULT_R( brp, drp[ k - Nr ] );
00601         drp[k] = GSM_ADD( erp[k], drpp );
00602     }
00603 
00604     /*
00605      *  Update of the reconstructed short term residual signal
00606      *  drp[ -1..-120 ]
00607      */
00608 
00609     for (k = 0; k <= 119; k++) drp[ -120 + k ] = drp[ -80 + k ];
00610 }

register word *  dpp,

00519 {
00520     register word     bp;
00521     register int      k;
00522     register longword ltmp;
00523 
00524 #   undef STEP
00525 #   define STEP(BP)                 \
00526     for (k = 0; k <= 39; k++) {         \
00527         dpp[k]  = GSM_MULT_R( BP, dp[k - Nc]);  \
00528         e[k]    = GSM_SUB( d[k], dpp[k] );  \
00529     }
00530 
00531     switch (bc) {
00532     case 0: STEP(  3277 ); break;
00533     case 1: STEP( 11469 ); break;
00534     case 2: STEP( 21299 ); break;
00535     case 3: STEP( 32767 ); break; 
00536     }
00537 }
